title: How do you self-review matches?
body:
I'm a very casual player, I play for fun don't care if I win or lose. But lately I've decided winning is more fun lol

So i got into the serious end of the stick and decided to start maining a champ properly, I researched and watched a heap of blitz games.
Since then, i've only dropped 1 game with him and won 14 of my last 15 games with blitz. But there's always room to improve and my stats are far from impressive.

I'd like to know what other people use in terms of self reviewing post games. Either recording the game, or software that tracks specific data or time stamped heat mapping of sorts. Is it possible to record a game, that has map fog disabled, so I can see what the enemy was doing at X time I made a certain mistake?? Keen to try further my blitz game and support role, before expanding my pool of 'main' champions.

replies.body:
Personally i just use Replay.GG because it means i can pick whatever game i want to re-watch and go through it.

And as a note, any replay, you can disable fog, see enemy wards and everything inbetween that.

Yes infact it is.

You can either use lolreplay, or my personal favourite is to use the op.gg record replay button since i usually have the tab open anyway

Wow. Can't believe I didn't even know about lolreplays... It's so simple!{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

Thanks a lot YBR
Nah youd be surprised how many "well known" third party tools actually arent all that well known.
